text: Map of Osterland in the 13th century. Osterland (terra orientalis) is a historical region in Germany. It was situated between the Elbe and Saale rivers to the north of Pleissnerland which it later absorbed and it included the city of Leipzig. The name derives from the previous name of the territory, Ostmark, meaning "eastern march." Today, the area belongs to the German states of Thuringia and Saxony. == See also == * List of regions of Saxony == External links == *Map of the Wettinc Lands with Osterland Category:Historical regions in Germany Category:Geography of Saxony Category:Regions of Thuringia Category:History of the Holy Roman Empire by location
title: Osterland
